meanings.definition: The sacred garments worn by Muslim pilgrims during the Hajj.
meanings.sent1: During the Hajj, the pilgrims wear their ihrams with reverence.
meanings.sent2: The ihrams are essential attire for the pilgrimage to Mecca.
meanings.sent3: The ihrams decided to take a break and relax in the shade.
meanings.sent4: The white ihrams symbolize purity and unity among the pilgrims.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the ihrams provided comfort during the long journey.

meanings.definition: The act of putting on these garments.
meanings.sent1: The ihrams require careful wrapping to ensure a proper fit.
meanings.sent2: After sunrise, the pilgrims perform the ihrams ritual.
meanings.sent3: The ihrams decided to have a race to see who could put them on the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Putting on the ihrams signifies the beginning of the sacred journey.
meanings.sent5: The pilgrims felt a sense of unity as they completed the ihrams together.
